Abstract: Russian Stocks Leap After Yeltsin Steps Aside  Boris N. Yeltsin's surprise resignation drove Russian stock prices up sharply, reflecting optimism that the acting president, Vladimir V. Putin, will revive stalled economic reforms. The Russian Trading System stock index rose 18 percent, its biggest one-day increase since July 14, 1998.
LeadParagraph: Russian Stocks Leap After Yeltsin Steps Aside
